instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video/Backlight...ugh
threads.message:
This board has thoroughly kicked my ass. I'm pretty comfortable with this type of issue, but this one I fear may have a CPU issue...

1. No video, no backlight. I do think the board had liquid at some point based on the eDP connector, but it must have been minor because no corrosion on any caps or anything.
2. 5v at L8300 for about 6 seconds, then it goes straight to 0v
3. Boots to external just fine; when I view displays in system prefs, nothing shows except the external display.
4. Diode on my eDP connector all match a working board. Voltages don't of course.
5. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high (3.3v)
6. Known-good 2015 display; tested with 2 other boards, display is definitely working fine.
7. Didn't find any shorts on <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> or anything.

When I do have 5v on L8300, there's no LCD activity at all, not even briefly. No panel shifting or data of any kind. Replaced <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> out of frustration because they do resolve a ton of these backlight/video issues, but no change at all. Replaced eDP connector because it had scaling from the board being cleaned, and it didn't look "perfect" (not damaged, but not A+). 

Any help or direction appreciated...this one has me baffled.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video/Backlight...ugh
threads.message: Check diode mode measurements at the end of a separate LCD cable to make sure the connector is good. Check continuity to the caps (<CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR> and up) from the LCD cable Also inspect for missing caps/resistors in the eDP lines.
